newsitem.title: PAPUA NEW GUINEA: RTRS - Kulim buys PNG's New Britain Palm Oil.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Kulim buys PNG's New Britain Palm Oil.

text.p: Malaysia's Kulim Berhad will buy 90 percent of the shares in New Britain Palm Oil Ltd from Britain's Harrisons & Crosfield Plc and the Papua New Guinea (PNG) government for US$117.2 million, PNG Prime Minister Julius Chan said on Thursday.
"Kulim will acquire the shares held by Harrisons & Crosfield (54 percent), the majority of the shares held by the state (30 percent) and POSFB (six percent)," Chan said in a statement.
The PNG government would retain a 10 percent interest in New Britain Palm Oil and transfer it into a trust on behalf of West New Britain, he said.
"The cost to Kulim will be US$117.2 million, or about 154.0 million Kina," Chan said.
He said Kulim had agreed to sell down 10 percent of its 90 percent stake to the West New Britain Trust, giving the trust a total 20 percent stake once the sell-down is complete.
